content.description: Sit start R hand pocket and L gaston on big hold.  Pull up to R hand sidepull.  Can bump again to another higher sidepull or just crank to higher jugs.  Easy mantle.  You have to dodge the tree a bit.
content.location: In Pocket Rocket area, on Grip Tape boulder, which is just east of Pocket Rocket.  See pics.

content.description: Sit start on pockets, pull up into big pod and finish with an easy top out.
content.location: In Pocket Rocket area, on Grip Tape boulder, which is just east of Pocket Rocket.  See pics.

content.description: Sit start with a heelhook and jugs. Follow flake rail all the way to the top.
content.location:
GPS: 39.30748, -111.11397

200 feet from Pocket Rocket.

Halfway between Pocket Rocket and I'd Rather be Climbing Her.

content.description: Sit start w/ hands on edges on both sides of the arete, One hard pull to jugs

Classic dyno.

Start on the Best Pocket in the World (tm) and a good sidepull, set your feet on the convenient edge, and fire for a perfect jug at the lip.

Perfect rock and a perfect landing means you can try it over and over again.
content.location: The main overhanging face at the Anarchy boulders.

content.description: Start to the left of Conman on a good rounded edge. Then, traverse into Conman.
content.protection: A pad but it's a low ball so you don't really need one.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious rail below the arete (Heel hook helpful).  Throw to arete and then lieback up the arete.  Mantle at the top is a little friction-ey if you follow the arete all the way to the top.  A fun little problem!    You can also mantle over the arete early and finish up the V0 slab, but that skips the best part.
content.location: In Pocket Rocket area, on Grip Tape boulder, which is just east of Pocket Rocket.  See pics.

content.description: Sit start at the juggy flake 3 ft off the ground.  Climb up and left.
content.location: around the corner to the left from Pocket Rocket

content.description: Super fun low ball that immediately catches your eye if you are at pocket rocket. Start on a feft pocket and a right “horseshoe” shaped crimp with a left heel hook. Scum your right foot underneath and pull hard to an in cut dish. The mantle can be tricky.
content.location: This boulder is immediately to your left if you are on the trail standing next to pocket rocket. The whole climb is about chest height. Approximately 2 feet off the trail.

content.description: Sit start on heart shaped hold. L hand to some sidepulls and R hand to a nice hold on the lip.  Tiptoe up the overhang and mantle.
content.location: In Pocket Rocket area, on Grip Tape boulder, which is just east of Pocket Rocket.  See pics.

content.description: Squat start on the ledge. The sit start is possible; from the verticle rail in the middle of the boulder, and throw right to the ledge.  Mantle onto ledge followed by easy topout.
content.location: In Pocket Rocket area, on Grip Tape boulder, which is just east of Pocket Rocket.  See pics.

content.description: To the left of Blender. Sit start and go up the arete type thing.
content.location: To the left of Blender. On the same boulder as Pocket Rocket.

content.description: Sit start on jug real low. work your way left to a big side pull flake and then bump again to a pinch. Come into a small crimp with your right hand and go straight up to the sharp lip. Might need to jump for it if your short. Doesn't look that good but its a fun climb.
content.location: This problem is on the same boulder as Pocket Rocket. If you were standing in front of Pocket Rocket this problem would be around the corner on the left side.
